  • Characteristic classes and transitions
  • circle_bundles.TransitionReport
  • View page source

circle_bundles.TransitionReport

class circle_bundles.TransitionReport(n_sets, n_samples, min_points, n_edges_requested, n_edges_estimated, missing_edges, overlap_sizes, rms_angle_err, max_rms_angle_err, mean_rms_angle_err)[source]

Bases: object

Summary statistics and diagnostics for transition estimation.

A TransitionReport is returned alongside an O2Cocycle by estimate_transitions(). It records basic sizes, missing overlaps, and per-edge fit errors.

Parameters:

  • n_sets (int)

  • n_samples (int)

  • min_points (int)

  • n_edges_requested (int)

  • n_edges_estimated (int)

  • missing_edges (List[Tuple[int, int]])

  • overlap_sizes (Dict[Tuple[int, int], int])

  • rms_angle_err (Dict[Tuple[int, int], float])

  • max_rms_angle_err (float)

  • mean_rms_angle_err (float)

n_sets

Number of cover sets (rows of U).

Type:

int

n_samples

Number of samples (columns of U).

Type:

int

min_points

Minimum overlap size required to estimate a transition on an edge.

Type:

int

n_edges_requested

Number of edges requested for estimation. If no explicit edge list is provided, this equals n_sets choose 2.

Type:

int

n_edges_estimated

Number of edges for which a transition was successfully estimated.

Type:

int

missing_edges

List of edges (j, k) that were requested but skipped due to insufficient overlap.

Type:

List[Tuple[int, int]]

overlap_sizes

Dict mapping each requested edge (j, k) to the number of overlap samples \(|U_j \cap U_k|\).

Type:

Dict[Tuple[int, int], int]

rms_angle_err

Dict mapping each estimated edge (j, k) to an RMS angular error (radians) measured on the overlap points.

Type:

Dict[Tuple[int, int], float]

max_rms_angle_err

Maximum RMS angular error among estimated edges (0 if no edges estimated).

Type:

float

mean_rms_angle_err

Mean RMS angular error among estimated edges (0 if no edges estimated).

Type:

float

Notes

The RMS angular error is computed after applying the estimated transition to unit vectors derived from angles, i.e. it measures discrepancy on S¹ (via arccos of dot products).

__init__(n_sets, n_samples, min_points, n_edges_requested, n_edges_estimated, missing_edges, overlap_sizes, rms_angle_err, max_rms_angle_err, mean_rms_angle_err)

  • max_rms_angle_err (float)

  • mean_rms_angle_err (float)

Return type:

None
